intro: Pimpinella danaa, commonly known as the Egyptian cow-wheat, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is native to the Mediterranean region and parts of North Africa. The plant features slender, branching stems and small, greenish-white flowers arranged in umbels. Its leaves are pinnately divided, contributing to its ornamental appeal. Pimpinella danaa is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in sunny to partially shaded environments.
